channel.title: Frequency on Massimiliano Canzi
channel.description: Recent content in Frequency on Massimiliano Canzi

item.title: the effect of lexical frequency on vowel phonation as a correlate of t glottaling
item.description: Presentations 2018 Stefano Coretta, Massimiliano Canzi The effect of lexical frequency on vowel phonation as a correlate of /t/- glottaling. Talk presented at the Linguistic Association of Great Britain (LAGB) conference in Sheffield, UK. 11-14th September, 2018. Resources You can find the research compendium (including data, analysis, code and slides/poster) for this project at the following link: LAGB 2018 Abstract Introduction. Lexical frequency is known to modulate the effects of a phonetic bias on speech production, such that high-frequency words show a stronger effect for a particular bias since they are exposed more often to that bias (Bybee 2004).
